jtxt.emulator.GString

    Package Description
    jtxt

    • Uses of GString in jtxt

      Fields in jtxt with type parameters of type GString 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<GString> GlyphBuffer.buffer
      The rows of GStrings which make up this frame.
      Methods in jtxt that return GString 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GString[] GlyphBuffer.getGlyphs(Region region)
      Given a region, this method will return all glyphs within that region as an array of strings.
      GString GlyphBuffer.getString(int line) 
      Methods in jtxt with parameters of type GString 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void GlyphBuffer.update(GString[] lines, Location start)
      For each GString in the array, this method updates the frame at the start location, starting at the given line and incrementing by one for each subsequent element in the array, and retaining the position for all lines added to the buffer.
      void GlyphBuffer.update(GString glyphs, Location start)
      Starting at the given Location, this method will will replace the glyphs from start to the length of the string, assuming that this string is within the bounds of the buffer.

      Inserts a new glyph into this string at the index.

      Constructs a GString for the given string of text.
      GString GString.set(int index, Glyph glyph)
      Sets the glyph in this string at the index to the given glyph, discarding the glyph that was at that position within the string previously.
      GString GString.substring(int start, int end)

      Wraps this string to the given length.
